Hedger Pressure Indicator

CoT hedger pressure: supply expansion & shortage stress.

As of 2025-12-23

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Hedger Pressure signal for 2025-12-23 indicates a Normal supply expansion pressure regime and a Moderate Shortage / Stress regime (1). This reflects a stable supply outlook alongside emerging signs of physical market tightness. Conviction Band: Medium, Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence, Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The Moderate Shortage / Stress regime is driven by `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z` at 0.576, placing it just above the 0.5 threshold (1). The `hedger_deep_long_share` is 0.223, indicating 22.3% of markets show hedgers heavily long. Supply expansion pressure remains Normal, with `Hedger_SupplyPressure_z` at 0.053 (1).
  • Conditional Invalidation: The signal would reverse if `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z` falls below 0.5, shifting the regime to Normal shortage pressure.

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Moderate Shortage / Stress persists (1), reflecting continued physical market tightness.
  • Most plausible upside risk: Increased Shortage / Stress, driven by `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z` rising above 1.0 (1), indicating growing physical supply issues.
  • Most plausible downside risk: Normalisation of shortage pressure, if deep long hedger positions unwind significantly, moving `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z` below 0.5.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months). Hedger positioning reflects commercial forward views, typically evolving over several months.
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: Medium. The signal provides a clear, non-extreme, directional insight into physical market conditions.

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Pricing, Supply. This signal directly informs commodity pricing pressures and global supply conditions (1).
  • Cycle position: Mid-late cycle. Tightening supply often emerges as demand matures in an economic cycle.
  • Typical interaction: It typically interacts with inflation signals (2), commodity price trends (e.g., Copper (3), Crude Oil (4)), and global growth proxies (5).

Data & References:

  • df_cot_signals, latest Report_Date 2025-12-23.
  • The `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z` (0.576) and `Hedger_ShortagePressure_Regime` (Moderate Shortage / Stress) were most influential.
  • 1–2 additional public datasets that would improve depth or reliability: Global inventory levels for key commodities (e.g., EIA for oil, LME for metals) and industrial production data (6).
